TopicTitle: Unusual object discovered on Mun (not munolith)

Articles.Content:
So on today\'s trip to the Mun I spotted a very unusual object near my landing site:

![21j9hdt.jpg](http://i45.tinypic.com/21j9hdt.jpg)

I decided to fly closer for a better look and this is what I got:

![xek9xe.jpg](http://i48.tinypic.com/xek9xe.jpg)

Now if I recall my high school geography right, arches can only form in nature from wind/water erosion. Since Mun doesn\'t have atmosphere or liquid water how is it possible this object came about?
The Space Kraken emerging from Munar soil? Lol.
I\'m not saying its aliens, but its aliens
I believe that\'s a challenge arch. Try to achieve a munar orbit that goes through it.
There\'s another one west of that one you\'re on now.

> 
> Now if I recall my high school geography right, arches can only form in nature from wind/water erosion. Since Mun doesn\'t have atmosphere or liquid water how is it possible this object came about?

Some of the MÃ¼n\'s craters also show evidence of water erosion. It must have had an odd history?

> 
> I believe that\'s a challenge arch. Try to achieve a munar orbit that goes through it.

Challenge accepted.
Update: This is going to be very difficult. The ground raises by 400m just past there on teh orbit you need to achieve... Will have to be an eliptical orbit, not circular.

I\'m going to go check this out. Is it possible that millions of years ago, other species lived on Kerbin and flew to the mun, building these arches and eventually going extinct? 

**YES IT IS....**

[Is such a thing even possible? Yes it is...](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UfSANfVf4-E#)

I flew up to it and inexplicably, my Lunar Module EXPLODED.

> ![index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12670.0;attach=20270;image](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12670.0;attach=20270;image)

> ![index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12670.0;attach=20272;image](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12670.0;attach=20272;image)

> 
> Now if I recall my high school geography right, arches can only form in nature from wind/water erosion. Since Mun doesn\'t have atmosphere or liquid water how is it possible this object came about?

It\'s the loop for when the Kraken needs to secure the Mun when he goes into a truck stop.

There are plenty of other methods such a structure could occur naturally. Consider that could be a vein of harder material that formed under a hill of softer terrain during the Mun\'s formation and much more tectonically active history, and then the softer material was blown away by a nearby meteor strike later on. True, the chances would be astronomical, but when you are dealing with astronomical objects, those odds tend to become pretty favorable.
